fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.cloudhopper

Class SessionBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.fluent.AbstractParent<CloudhopperBuilder>
      • fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.cloudhopper.SessionBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<CloudhopperSessionOptions>, Parent<CloudhopperBuilder>

    public class SessionBuilder
extends AbstractParent<CloudhopperBuilder>
implements Builder<CloudhopperSessionOptions>
    Configures Cloudhopper session management (timeouts, retry, session name...).
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Constructor Detail

      • SessionBuilder

        public SessionBuilder(CloudhopperBuilder parent,
                      BuildContext buildContext)
        Initializes the builder with a parent builder. The parent builder is used when calling AbstractParent.and() method. The EnvironmentBuilder is used to evaluate properties when build() method is called.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent builder
        buildContext - for registering instances and property evaluation

    • Method Detail

      • sessionName

        public SessionBuilder sessionName(String name)
        A name for the session (used to name threads).

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using sessionName(). 

         .sessionName("my-name")
 .sessionName()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("default-name")
 
         .sessionName("my-name")
 .sessionName()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("default-name")
        In both cases, sessionName("my-name") is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        name - the name for the session
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • sessionName

        public ConfigurationValueBuilder<SessionBuilder,String> sessionName()
        A name for the session (used to name threads).

        This method is mainly used by Configurers to register some property keys and/or a default value. The aim is to let developer be able to externalize its configuration (using system properties, configuration file or anything else). If the developer doesn't configure any value for the registered properties, the default value is used (if set). 

         .sessionName()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("default-name")

        Non-null value set using sessionName(String) takes precedence over property values and default value. 

         .sessionName("my-name")
 .sessionName()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("default-name")
        The value "my-name" is used regardless of the value of the properties and default value.

        See ConfigurationValueBuilder for more information.

        Returns:
        the builder to configure property keys/default value

      • bindTimeout

        public SessionBuilder bindTimeout(Long timeout)
        Set the maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) to wait for the success of a bind attempt to the SMSC. Defaults to 5000.

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using bindTimeout(). 

         .bindTimeout(1000L)
 .bindTimeout()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(5000L)
 
         .bindTimeout(1000L)
 .bindTimeout()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(5000L)
        In both cases, bindTimeout(1000L) is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout value in milliseconds
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • connectRetry

        public RetryBuilder<SessionBuilder> connectRetry()
        Configures how to handle a connection that fails. You can configure if retry should be done when a connection to the server couldn't be established. The builder lets you define the retry behavior. For now, only a FixedDelayRetry is handled. The FixedDelayRetry needs a delay between two tries and a maximum attempts. In the future, we could handle different strategies if needed like retrying with an exponential delay for example. If you don't configure it, no retry is applied at all.
        Returns:
        the builder to configure the retry handling

      • requestExpiryTimeout

        public SessionBuilder requestExpiryTimeout(Long timeout)
        Set the amount of time (milliseconds) to wait for an endpoint to respond to a request before it expires. Defaults to disabled (-1).

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using requestExpiryTimeout(). 

         .requestExpiryTimeout(1000L)
 .requestExpiryTimeout()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(-1L)
 
         .requestExpiryTimeout(1000L)
 .requestExpiryTimeout()

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

      • windowMonitorInterval

        public SessionBuilder windowMonitorInterval(Long timeout)
        Sets the amount of time (milliseconds) between executions of monitoring the window for requests that expire. It's recommended that this generally either matches or is half the value of requestExpiryTimeout. Therefore, at worst a request would could take up 1.5X the requestExpiryTimeout to clear out. Defaults to -1 (disabled).

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using windowMonitorInterval(). 

         .windowMonitorInterval(1000L)
 .windowMonitorInterval()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(-1L)
 
         .windowMonitorInterval(1000L)
 .windowMonitorInterval()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(-1L)
        In both cases, windowMonitorInterval(1000L) is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        timeout - the tiemout in milliseconds
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • windowSize

        public SessionBuilder windowSize(Integer size)
        Sets the maximum number of requests permitted to be outstanding (unacknowledged) at a given time. Must be > 0. Defaults to 1.

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using windowSize(). 

         .windowSize(5)
 .windowSize()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(1)
 
         .windowSize(5)
 .windowSize()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(1)
        In both cases, windowSize(5) is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        size - the window size
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • responseTimeout

        public SessionBuilder responseTimeout(Long timeout)
        Set the maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) to wait until a valid response is received when a "submit" request is synchronously sends to the remote endpoint. The timeout value includes both waiting for a "window" slot, the time it takes to transmit the actual bytes on the socket, and for the remote endpoint to send a response back. Defaults to 5000.

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using responseTimeout(). 

         .responseTimeout(1000L)
 .responseTimeout()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(5000L)
 
         .responseTimeout(1000L)
 .responseTimeout()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(5000L)
        In both cases, responseTimeout(1000L) is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout in milliseconds
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • unbindTimeout

        public SessionBuilder unbindTimeout(Long timeout)
        Set the maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) to wait until the session is unbounded, waiting up to a specified period of milliseconds for an unbind response from the remote endpoint. Regardless of whether a proper unbind response was received, the socket/channel is closed. Defaults to 5000.

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using unbindTimeout(). 

         .unbindTimeout(10000L)
 .unbindTimeout()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(5000L)
 
         .unbindTimeout(10000L)
 .unbindTimeout()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(5000L)
        In both cases, unbindTimeout(10000L) is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout in milliseconds
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • reuseSession

        public ReuseSessionBuilder reuseSession()
        Reuse the previous session instead of closing and reopening one if possible. However, if the session has been closed by the remote server, a new session will be created.

        When sending the first message, a new session is created. Later, when sending the next message, if the session is still alive, this session is reused. As the connection is not actively maintained, the session may be killed by the server. Therefore to check if the session is still alive, an EnquireLink request is sent. If a response is received from the server, then the session is still alive and the message can be sent using the same session. If a failure response or no response is received after some time from the server, then a new session must be created.

        To check if the session is still alive, the EnquireLink request is sent just before sending the real message. In order to prevent sending an EnquireLink request before every message, the date of the last sent message or EnquireLink is kept. This date is compared to a delay to ensure that no EnquireLink is sent during this delay.

        This builder let you configure:

        • Enable/disable reuse session management
        • The maximum time to wait for a response from the server for EnquireLink request
        • The time to wait before sending a new EnquireLink request again

        NOTE: If keepAlive() strategy is enabled, this option has no effect.

        Returns:
        the builder to configure reuse session strategy

      • keepAlive

        public KeepAliveBuilder keepAlive()
        Configure keep alive management. Keep alive strategy actively maintains the session opened by sending EnquireLink messages to the server.

        Even if client sends messages to keep session alive, the connection may be broken or closed by the server. Therefore, automatic reconnection is done.

        This builder let you configure:

        • Enable/disable active keep alive management
        • The time to wait between two EnquireLink messages
        • The maximum time to wait for a response from the server for EnquireLink request
        NOTE: If this strategy is enabled, reuseSession() has no effect.
        Returns:
        the builder to configure keep alive management

      • build

        public CloudhopperSessionOptions build()
        Description copied from interface: Builder
        Instantiate and configures the instance.
        Specified by:
        build in interface Builder<CloudhopperSessionOptions>
        Returns:
        The built instance
